ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Did you ever have a period when you felt extremely good or high, clearly different from your normal self? (Was this more than just feeling good?)
Did you ever have a period when you were unusually irritable, clearly different from your normal self so that you would shout at people or start fights or arguments?
Have you ever had periods lasting even a day or two when you felt unusually cheerful, irritable, energetic, or hyper?
Have there been times when you felt much more energetic than usual and needed less sleep than usual?
INTERVIEWER: Probe for additional symptoms if necessary, using additional probes.
Did this last persistently throughout the day or intermittently for two days or more?
INTERVIEWER: Do you suspect a past or current episode from subjects responses, behavior, or other information?
Have you been feeling that way recently (i.e., during the past 30 days)?
How long have you felt this way? Days
How long have you felt this way? Weeks
Think about the most extreme period in your life when you were feeling unusually good, high, or irritable. When did it begin?
INTERVIEWER: Compute age.
How long did that period last? Days
How long did that period last? Weeks
INTERVIEWER: Is the most severe episode also the current episode?
INTERVIEWER: Specify and code whether subjects mood was:
Notes: 1= Irritable; 2= Elated/Expansive; 3= Both irritable and elated

ElementDescription: Were you more active than usual either sexually, socially, or at work, or were you physically restless?
Were you more talkative than usual or did you feel pressure to keep on talking?
Did your thoughts race or did you talk so fast that it was difficult for people to follow what you were saying?
Did you feel you were a very important person, or that you had special powers, plans, talents, or abilities?
Did you need less sleep than usual?
How many hours of sleep did you get per night?
How many hours of sleep do you usually get per night?

Did you have more trouble than usual concentrating because your attention kept
jumping from one thing to another?
Did you do anything that could have gotten you into trouble-like buy things, make business investments, have sexual indiscretions, drive recklessly?
If yes: Specify:
INTERVIEWER: Enter number of boxes with YES responses in questions 6-12

During this episode was there at least a week when these symptoms (INTERVIEWER: Review symptoms in questions 6-12 plus elated/irritable mood or hand subject Mania Tally Sheet to review) were present most of the time?
Would you say your behavior was provocative, obnoxious, arrogant, or manipulative enough to cause problems for your family, friends, or co-workers?
If yes: Specify:
Were you so excited that it was almost impossible to hold a conversation with you?

During this episode, did you have beliefs or ideas that you later found out were not true? Probe: Like believing that you had powers and abilities others did not have? Or that you had a special mission, perhaps from God? Or that someone was trying to harm you? How certain were you?
INTERVIEWER: If delusions are suspected, probe further to determine the content and whether the beliefs were held with certainty. Code on the basis of this information and describe below:
Were you convinced of these beliefs at the time?
Did these beliefs occur either just before this episode or after it cleared?
How long were they present before the episode began?
How long did they last after your mood returned to normal?
INTERVIEWER: Does this total more than 14 days?
Did you see or hear things that other people could not see or hear?
If yes: Specify:
Were you using any street drugs at the times that you experienced these (refer to experiences)?
What were they? (INTERVIEWER: List the drugs used and describe the frequency of use and doses, if possible.)
Did these voices usually seem to originate: from within your head?
Did these voices usually seem to originate: from outside your head?
Did these voices usually seem to originate: from some particular place outside your head?
Did these voices usually seem to originate: Were these voices definitely different from your own thoughts?
Did these (refer to experiences) occur either just before this episode or after it cleared?
How long were they present before the episode began?
How long did they last after your mood returned to normal?
INTERVIEWER: Does this total more than 14 days?
INTERVIEWER: Did psychotic symptoms have content that was inconsistent with manic themes such as inflated worth, power, knowledge, identity, or special relationship to a deity or a famous person?
INTERVIEWER: Was the subject preoccupied with psychotic symptoms to the exclusion of other symptoms or concerns?
Did you seek or receive help from a doctor or other professional?
Were you prescribed medication or was there a change in your dosage?
If yes: Specify:
During this episode were you admitted to the hospital (including day hospital)?
For how long (inpatient)?
For how long (day hospital) ?
Did you receive ECT (shock treatments)?
Was your major responsibility during this episode job, home, school, or something else?
If other: Specify:
Was your functioning (in this role) affected?
If other: Specify:
Did something negative happen as a result of this (such as marital separation, absence from work or school, loss of a job, or lower grades)?
If other: Specify:
Did someone notice a change in your functioning?
INTERVIEWER: Code based on answers to questions 15-24
Specify:
Was your functioning in any other area of your life affected or did you get into trouble in any way?
If yes: Specify:
Did this episode occur during or shortly after a serious physical illness?
If yes: Specify:
Did this episode begin shortly after you started using decongestants, steroids, or some other medication?
If yes: Specify medications:
Did this episode begin shortly after you began taking an antidepressant, shortly after you started a course of ECT, or after beginning a course of light therapy?
If yes: Specify medications:
Were you using cocaine or other street drugs or were you drinking more than usual just before this episode began?
Cocaine?
If yes: Specify:
Other street drugs?
Specify drug and quantity:
Increased use of alcohol?
If yes: Specify:
During this episode did you have a week or more during which your mood frequently changed between irritability or elation and sadness or depression?
During this episode did you also experience any of these symptoms: Diminished desire for food, or marked overeating?
During this episode did you also experience any of these symptoms: Inability to sleep when sleep was desired, or excessive sleep?
During this episode did you also experience any of these symptoms: Feeling slowed down?
During this episode did you also experience any of these symptoms: Having fatigue or a loss of energy?
During this episode did you also experience any of these symptoms: Losing interest in pleasurable activities?
During this episode did you also experience any of these symptoms: Feeling guilty or worthless?
During this episode did you also experience any of these symptoms: Being unable to think or retain written information?
During this episode did you also experience any of these symptoms: Feeling suicidal or thinking a lot about death?
INTERVIEWER: Enter number of YES responses in 31.a.1-8:
How long were these symptoms present? Days
How long were these symptoms present? Weeks
How many episodes like this have you had?
INTERVIEWER: Refer to the instructions below, and indicate here whether a second episode of mania/hypomania will be rated.
Briefly describe how the Other Episode was selected:
Is the selected episode also a current episode (in the past 30 days)?
When did it begin?
INTERVIEWER: Compute age.
How long did that period last? Days
How long did that period last? Weeks
INTERVIEWER: Specify and code whether subjects mood was:
Notes: 1= Irritable; 2= Elated/Expansive; 3= Both irritable and elated

INTERVIEWER: Has there been at least one clean episode of mania/hypomania? A clean episode is one WITHOUT prior physical illness, drug or alcohol abuse, or organic precipitants.
Clean periods with significant role impairment (mania): Number of clean manias (include mixed periods):
Clean periods with significant role impairment (mania): Age at first and last clean manic periods: Ons Age
Clean periods with significant role impairment (mania): Age at first and last clean manic periods: Rec Age
Clean periods without significant role impairment (hypomania): Number of clean hypomanias (include mixed periods):
Clean periods without significant role impairment (hypomania): Age at first and last clean hypomanic periods: Ons Age
Clean periods without significant role impairment (hypomania): Age at first and last clean hypomanic periods: Rec Age
If no clean episodes: Unclean periods with significant role impairment (mania): Number of unclean manias (include mixed periods):
Unclean periods with significant role impairment (mania): Age at first and last unclean manic periods: Ons Age
Unclean periods with significant role impairment (mania): Age at first and last unclean manic periods: Rec Age
Unclean periods without significant role impairment (hypomania): Number of unclean hypomanias (include mixed periods):
Unclean periods without significant role impairment (hypomania): Age at first and last unclean hypomanic periods: Ons Age
Unclean periods without significant role impairment (hypomania): Age at first and last unclean hypomanic periods: Rec Age
How many times were you hospitalized for an episode of mania? (inpatient)
How many times were you hospitalized for an episode of mania? (day hospital)
Do your episodes tend to begin in any particular season? (Up to 3 seasons may be coded)
Notes: 0= No Pattern; 1= Winter; 2= Spring; 3= Summer; 4= Fall; 9= Unknown

ElementDescription: Think about your first manic episode. Did it begin with a period of time when you didnt sleep (or slept very little) for several nights?
How many nights?
How many hours did you sleep each night?
How about your most recent manic episode? Did it begin with a period like that?
How about your most severe manic episode? Did it begin with a period like that?
Did most of your manic episodes begin with a period of sleeplessness?
Have you ever switched back and forth quickly from feeling high to feeling normal, or from feeling high to feeling depressed without a normal mood in between?
If yes: When did this switch in your mood happen?
Notes: 1, every few hours | 2, every few days, or | 3, every few weeks?

ElementDescription: Have you ever had a year when you had several different manic, hypomanic, depressive, or mixed episodes?
Altogether, how many different manic, hypomanic, depressive, or mixed episodes did you have during that year?
Describe:
Are you sure you got better between episodes?
For how long?
